item.title: Ticket #1287 (Deleting category should not always add default cat to posts) updated
item.dc:creator: Ozh

item.title: Ticket #1287 (Deleting category should not always add default cat to posts) created
item.dc:creator: Ozh
item.description:
When deleting a category, Worpdress doesn't set them to the default category : it *adds* the default category.

I think this is a normal behaviour when a post has only one category. However, I think this is unwanted when posts have more than one category, and the default category should not be added

Example : a post filed in : "Code, PHP, Wordpress, Cool" When deleting the "Cool" category : "Code, PHP, Wordpress, General" Doesn't make much sense in my opinion :)

So my opinion (opinion of a user who just went under recategorizing 250 posts) is that when a post has multiple cat, don't add default cat when deleting one. Of course if the post end up belonging to none, add default one.

Sorry for not writing something more short

item.title: Ticket #1285 (WordPress user-agent string missing version number when sending pingback) updated
item.dc:creator: error

item.title: Ticket #1285 (WordPress user-agent string missing version number when sending pingback) created
item.dc:creator: error
item.description:
The user agent appears as "WordPress/ PHP/4.3.10". Adding "global $wp_version;" as below in wp-includes/comment-functions.php fixes the issue.

function discover_pingback_server_uri($url, $timeout_bytes = 2048) {

global $wp_version;

item.title: Ticket #1284 (1.5.1 does not post pingbacks sent from 1.5 blogs) updated
item.dc:creator: error
item.description: MC_incubus tells me his 1.5 blog wasn't able to post a PB here due to some fatal error when my WP tried to read his blog entry. He re-uploaded WP and solved the problem. This might be written off as user error, but there's a lot of users, and I'm missing a lot of pingbacks from 1.5 blogs.

item.title: Ticket #1284 (1.5.1 does not post pingbacks sent from 1.5 blogs) updated
item.dc:creator: error

item.title: Ticket #1284 (1.5.1 does not post pingbacks sent from 1.5 blogs) created
item.dc:creator: error
item.description:
Just what it says: 1.5.1 does not post pingbacks which come from 1.5 sites. It will post pingbacks that come from 1.5.1 sites, and 1.2.2 sites, but not 1.5 sites.

This was duplicated by a single site (IP Address) which has three test blogs: 1.2.2, 1.5 and 1.5.1-2005-04-24, all sending pings to another site (another IP address) running 1.5.1-2005-04-24.

The xmlrpc.log for each on the receiving end indicates nothing untoward; in all three cases the output looks OK. However, with the pingback sent from the 1.5 blog never appears on the site; the other two do appear.
